headline: Sarah's Banana Bread Muffins
description: This is a simple banana bread muffin recipe with crunchy walnuts in every bite. Easy to make and perfectly portable for a quick on-the-go breakfast.
name: Sarah's Banana Bread Muffins

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners.

Mix sugar, oil, and egg in a large bowl until light and creamy. Stir in bananas and walnuts. Add flour, baking soda, and salt; stir until completely smooth. Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 30 to 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Good recipe! This was my first time making muffins. I did make a few changes for personal preference: 2/3 cup sugar, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, and a bit of cinnamon, plus some chocolate chips. It is the perfect pastry ü•ß
It was amazing! I added an extra banana and a half and pecans instead of walnuts [allergies], and me and my family loved them 5 stars.

Loved it! However, I added some things based on the little flavor that seemed to exist in the original recipe‚Ä¶ 1/4 teaspoon each of ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Also about 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Dusted the top with cinnamon, nutmeg, and powdered sugar.
I half the sugar with brown sugar and watch the time I think it took 15-16 mins but were very tasty and also did the coconut

This is exactly the recipe I was looking for, thanks! I made a couple of adaptations: ‚Ä¢ I used only 1/2 the sugar (as I always do) ‚Ä¢ I added 1/2 cup mini chocolate chips ‚Ä¢ I also added 1/4 cup chia seeds, but that only added nutrition, not texture or flavor
THIS RECIPE WAS AMAZINGGG
Quick and easy. I modified by using gluten free baking flour and also added 1/4 tsp vanilla. Delicious!
I followed this recipe to the letter and it turned out so well. Every muffin was the same size and color! The taste was exactly like eating a slice of banana bread.
I did add a bit of vanilla and some 1 teaspoon of cinnamon. No walnuts. Made smaller cup cake size, cook time was 350 for 23 minutes, probably could have been 20.
It was absolutely delicious!!! It came out beautifully ‚ô•Ô∏è
simple and tasty
The texture and flavor was just like eating banana bread.
I made this recipe and it was great . I ended up getting 16 muffins from the batch.
Great base recipe. Used 1/2 C white sugar and 1/4 C brown sugar. Added 1 T maca powder, cacao nibs, and toasted coconut. Topped with extra banana, cacao, coconut, and a sprinkle of brown sugar.
Great recipe ! Used a mini muffin pan to manage portions and they turned out delicious!
Changed the walnuts to Chocolate chips! Turned out perfectly. Thank you
Perfect
Yummy! I used the coconut instead of walnuts and they are 12 yo kid approved as well! Super easy recipe.

Love these muffins! Followed some suggestions from some of the reviews. Used 1/2 cup of sugar, 1/4 cup of vegetable oil and 1/4cup of applesauce, a teaspoon of cinnamon, and a teaspoon of vanilla extract. Also added 1/2 cup of dried cranberries, and topped with walnuts for decoration. Baked for 20 minutes. Healthier and delicious version!
Used 1/2 brown sugar 1/2 white and coconut oil, added vanilla, cinnamon, and a tiny bit of cardamom, raw sugar on top, baked standard size muffins for 25‚Äô. Really came out nicely!
This is ALWAYS my go to recipe for banana muffins and I use GF flour and sometimes I add chocolate chips. They‚Äôre a favorite in my house!

I love these and have made them often. I usually tweak the recipe. For example I always use a teaspoon of vanilla and omit the lemon. I also triple the amount of nuts. Last time I had four bananas so I increased the flour by 1/2 cup and added a little milk to get the batter to the consistency I wanted
My substitutions: 1/2 cup sugar, 4 bananas, whole wheat flour												My additions: 2T ground flax, 2T hemp hearts, 1t vanilla, 1t cinnamon

This recipe is a great base leaving room to add your own additional flavors. I did add 1 1/2 tsp of vanilla 1/2 tsp cinnamon and a pinch of nutmeg bc I drink coffee with my muffins and those flavors all pair well with coffee and banana. Thanks for the recipe
I didn't like it at all, sorry.
Made 2 batches in 3 days....that says a lot. Super moist. Delicious!
Love this muffins . Made them for a breakfast meeting and everyone loved them. they are number one go to Breakfast items.

Happy fall! I made these muffins this morning. I cut half the sugar I added 1/2 of a large avocado and I used pumpkin seeds. I also added a teaspoon of cinnamon and a teaspoon of vanilla extract.The recipe made 12. They taste great and turned out lovely I‚Äôll make them again
I added dried cranberries and pecans. It is a great recipe simple and quick to make.
Tried it with one change i added stevia instead of sugar. Two of my kids are diabetic. They were very nice and moist and my children love them.
Pretty good... easy.

It was a simple recipe to follow and I followed the direction to the dot and I came out with a soft moist inside with a hard outside. The muffins were a light brown color. Im not sure what was missing to perfect it.
Adding chocolate chips makes it taste way better too!
This was basic banana muffin recipe. It was good. Don't understand why folk was fussing about it being too sweet. It tasted delicious to me.
It's very tasty!! I would just recommend not having them in the oven 30-40mins, but rather 25-30mins for them to be moist.
I put chocolate chips on top
Yummy
This recipe is so good, the muffins are delicious. As the recipe noted, I replaced the walnuts with coconut flakes.
yummy, just the right amount of sweetness.
These have been an absolute hit every time I‚Äôve made them. I also experimented with adding 1/2 tablespoon of cinnamon, which also tastes great!
My boys loved it! Devoured everything in 2 days! :)

Very tasty! I didn‚Äôt put in the walnuts as I don‚Äôt have any on hand, but the muffins turned out great. 

Con: I recommend checking them before 30 minutes as mine were ALMOST dry. 
Pro: They have a crispy top which was my favorite. 

Without the nuts, I made 14 regular sized muffins.
Really liked these. Followed the changes other made in reducing sugar, adding cinnamon and vanilla. I also added half a cup of unsweetened coconut in place of the walnuts. Turned out great.

Made this muffins with a few changes that are insanely good!! First, I used walnut oil instead of vegetable oil; I used cacao nibs instead of walnuts, and I used 1 cup of whole wheat flour instead of 2 cups of all purpose flour. I have had to make them multiple times because my friends and family are begging for them! they turn out kinda ugly but taste AMAZING.
Great muffins! My only sub was butter instead of oil!
Super easy & not many ingredients. I didn‚Äôt have nuts, but the family didn‚Äôt mind. Tastes great & easy to make

Copied another review (thanks, FLEUR-DE-LYS!), reduced sugar and adjusted flavors. They were tasty! 30 mins baking was about perfect.

When I make again:
- Cut sugar to 1/2c sugar and 1/4c brown sugar.
- Add 1/2tsp vanilla extract, maybe a splash of almond or orange extract too!
- Add a pinch of cinnamon still
- Swap out nuts for 1/2c chocolate chunks
- Top before baking with brown sugar and cinnamon (maybe even look up how to make a real crumble!)
These were delicious. I listened to a few people and added cinnamon and coconut. I also made a topping with mini chocolate chips ,coconut and brown sugar.

The recipe was delicious and the texture was very light. The reason I give 4 stars is because I made quite a few small changes and as such I can't evaluate the recipe alone. The changes I made are as follows:
 - Bake at 325¬∞ for 30 minutes
 - 1/2 cup of sugar and 2 egg yolks, with 1 egg white
 - 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla and pinches of cloves, nutmeg, allspice, ginger, and cinnamon added to the finished batter before pouring
 - About 3/4 teaspoon baking soda (I left a bit in my teaspoon) instead of the full teaspoon and about 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder (also an estimate) added. This reduces the baking soda flavor that is common in banana bread.

These are delicious! I didn‚Äôt have enough vegetable oil so I used extra virgin olive oil and it makes these tasty perfect! I didn‚Äôt add walnuts since I don‚Äôt like them but I added extra banana on top and they turned out perfect. My only complaint is that the time listed was too long and I ended up taking them out at around 25 minutes and I‚Äôm glad I didn‚Äôt wait to check them.
I need to adjust the baking time. The top was kind of hard. It was good. My kids ate it all up.

Cute the sugar in half, replaced half of that with brown sugar , added some baking powder and vanilla and they‚Äôre perfect! Would actually cut down the baking soda and add a little more sugar if I did this again
I added 1/2 a cup of milk as it was too dry
Delicious. They turned out great !

I wanted to make this as written since I don't like to rate a recipe when it's been changed. But, I was concerned that I didn't have enough mashed banana so added about a 1/4 cup applesauce. I also inadvertently chopped a bit too many walnuts and didn't want to waste anything. I had about a 1/3 cup of walnuts. I don't think either of these made any significant difference to flavour or texture so I will rate it the same as I would have otherwise. My husband and I both thought they were very good. The texture was nice. I will make them again.
I like this recepie but add 1 extra egg, 3/4 cup of sugar and 1 cup chocolate chips. Also top it with walnuts instead of mixing in. Gives a rich roasted nut flavor.
Similar to others I reduced the sugar and think they turned out great! I made these with only 1/2 cup sugar and added in a tap of vanilla. Yum!
These were so easy and (in the words of my 3 year old) deeeeelicious! I made the default 12 servings and it made six mini banana Bundt cakes.
Good but the bake time was way off. Checked it at 25 minutes and they were done...over done actually. They probably needed closer to 20 minutes. I would make them again though.
I didn't have walnuts so I used almonds and mini chocolate chips. Baked for 21 minutes to a golden brown. 30 would have been way too long.
Reduced sugar to 3/4th cup. Added 1tsp cinnamon and 1tsp vanilla. Added 2 eggs. Added chopped almonds. Turned out to be yum fluffy muffins.
Reduced sugar to 3/4th cup. Added 1tsp cinnamon and 1tsp vanilla. Added 2 eggs. Added chopped almonds. Turned out to be yum fluffy muffins.

My family LOVED them! I had one request to add chocolate chips next time. I will make 6 with chocolate chips and 6 without. We omitted the walnuts as we're not a family that enjoys any form of nuts in our baked goods! We may substitute coconut sugar next time we make as founf them quite sweet or will adjust the amount of sugar to 3/4 cup and 1 tsp of vanilla.
I put half cup sugar and half cup applesauce Thank you so much have a great day

I made the recipe exactly as listed (you‚Äôve got to have a baseline!) and it was super tasty. I have a sweet tooth and even so I found it a little sweet - I think I would use half the sugar next time. The crunch of the walnuts is a nice touch. Would make it again with half the sugar!
These were very dry. Did not even bake them the entire 30 minutes. Used a dark non-stick pan so dropped temperature to 325. Will not make again.
I did the vanilla and cinnamon and accidentally added too much vanilla. We will see how they taste

I‚Äôve made these about 20 times so far. I first made these muffins using mini chocolate chips instead of walnuts and adding cinnamon sugar to the tops before baking. They were fantastic!Here‚Äôs where the happy accident happened.Typically, some of the cinnamon sugar spills off when handling. One day, I prepared a batch early and left the unbaked muffins on the counter for several hours. After baking, the cinnamon became a crunchy topping. The guests raved about them (at three different brunches!) and thought, because of the fancy topping, that they were from a bakery.Apparently the cinnamon sugar had soaked up liquid from the batter while sitting out and this formed the crunchy topping. So now, rather than leave them out for several hours, I spritz the cinnamon sugar a few times with water before baking.
I love this recipe. Added a teaspoon of vanilla extract and some cinnamon. They baked at 350¬∞ for only 25 minutes though.
Substitute pecans for walnuts, add 1 Tbls. finely chopped orange peel, if using med. size bread pans bake for 1 hour.
I cut down on the sugar and added vanilla as many suggested. If you like a sweeter muffin, add all the sugar. they were really yummy, though!
Very good! After reading some of the reviews I decreased the sugar by a quarter cup. I used applesauce instead of oil. Family loved them!
We love these muffins so much! Always add milk chocolate chips, vanilla, and some cinnamon!
It's really moist and easy to make. This the first time I made it, and I added 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla flavor and only used a dash of salt. It tasted really good! Thanks for sharing.
Subbed real butter. Added one extra egg, added vanilla, added cinnamon
I made it just like the recipe stayed. The batter was thick and they were a little dry.
I skipped the walnuts based on preference but they were so good! I might add sour cream next time to make them the best they can be
The recipe is very good. I added some cinnamon and vanilla extract.
Made as recipe but was out of veg oil so used coconut oil stepped through cups maybe should used lil less? But good anyway just wiped bottoms. Maybe healthier this way? So I will think that

Fabulous! Like other reviewers I added extra seasonings: 1/2 tsp vanilla, 1/2 tsp orange extract, 1/4 tsp almond extract, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, and a dash of cloves. Made it two nights in a row. Great crumb!
it was not very sweet but I sill like it
These muffins came out delicious! I added hazelnuts instead of walnuts, and added some vanilla and cinnamon. They were perfect! Thank you for sharing this recipe!

I don‚Äôt even know how I‚Äôm going to fix this you can‚Äôt even mix it properly it‚Äôs so thick I don‚Äôt even know what to do with this recipe I doubled it to make for a whole bunch of people and this is what came out can‚Äôt even finish mixing it
These muffins rise beautifully and smell like heaven. The edges are crisp and the middle is sweet and moist. My kids give these muffins 20 stars. Maybe 20 million stars.
Delicious and came out perfect
Lacks major flavour. Not super impressed. Kids didn‚Äôt mind though, technique is good but flavour is poor.
Yes applesauce instead of oil yummy
yes I had chocolate chip
It was awesome. I replaced it with whole flour. Came out good and tasty

Very moist and great flavor because of the butter instead of oil. If you put streusel on top, bake and eat them the same day, I baked mine the night before and the abundance of moisture from the bananas caused them to become very soggy.
I cooked for 15-20min for regular muffins. Made some minis and a big one. I

I have made this recipe twice. Easy and delicious. 
I've shared with my sister in law.
I added another egg to the batter. They only required about 25 minutes cooking time in my classic muffin tins. My bananas were super ripe, so these muffins had good banana flavor.

I also add coconut and golden raisins with the crushed walnuts. Adds to the texture and flavor Great in the muffins and the Banan bread. Coconut, nuts, and golden raisins are also yummy in zucchini bread Both breads freeze great to have in the winter for when zucchini is not in season. I do however freeze shredded zucchini and mashed bananas, in 3 cup measurements, for when I need to quickly bake a loaf or two but don‚Äôt have the main ingredients on hand. Just take them out of the freezer. They thaw quickly
Way too dry! I think the flour amount should be 1 1/2 instead of 2 cups.
No changes necessary...these muffins were easy to make and were delicious. I will make them again!
Easy & moist. Loved it!
I should have cut back on the cooking time. Did not need the full 30 minutes but overall very tasty
Very sweet! Otherwise very easy to make and my teen loved them. I made 15 muffins with this recipe.
